Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ColorDetectionController
    This class is the controller of the color sensor which can detect the RGB values of object in the outside world.
    Display
    This class is used to access the robot's LCD screen and display whatever output is desired.
    HookController
    This class contains the method controlling the movement of the hook by acting on the EV3 motor attached to it.
    LightSensorController
    This class is used to control the two light sensors placed in front of each of the robot's wheels.
    Main
    This class is the starting point of our program, but is mainly used to instantiate the main controller which implements the solution to the design problem by calling in sequence the high-level software components of our solution.
    MainController
    This class is the starting point of the design solution.
    Navigation
    This class contains methods that dictate the movements of the robot, ranging from atomic methods to move the robot a certain distance or turn the robot a certain angle to more complex and compound methods such as the traversal algorithm for the search zone and the return algorithm to go from the stranded cart back to the starting corner.
    Odometer
    The odometer class keeps track of the robot's (x, y, theta) position.
    PathFinder
    This class implements the atomic path-finding functions that allow the robot to compute the optimal path to a desired grid coordinate.
    Resources
    This class is used to define static resources in one place for easy access and to avoid cluttering the rest of the codebase.
    UltraSonicController
    This class communicates with the US sensor and can be instantiated as a thread.
    WifiConnection
    This class handles the acquisition of the Wi-Fi parameters from the server.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    PathFinder.Grid
    Enumeration for the status of the grid.
